item.description:
We're trying out a bike hike on a linear trail! This mostly flat linear trail starts in Farmington and the section we'll cover heads north through Avon, Simsbury, East Grandby, and possibly even Suffield. Some portions of the trail cross roads and in some other portions we must travel some roads to get to the next section of the linear trail. I'll give this ride a 2 hour window where we'll see how far out we can go in an hour and then back again to where we started. I figure we'll at least cover 10 miles total [5 mph] but no more than about 40 miles total [20 mph] (20 miles out would be the MA border but that would mean a 40 mile total).

We'll meet at the parking area in Farmington at Noon and should be done by 2 PM. The parking area is located on Brickyard Road approximately 1 mile north of Route 4. (See the map for the Farmington section of the trail in the Notes section of the event.)

From I-84:Take exit 39 to Route 4 West. Turn right onto Brickyard Road (gong north). The parking area is on the left.

Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup....) is leading on this one so please direct questions to him.

** Please remember to bring water! **

The trail is much more complete than the 2002 era maps below indicate but these are the only maps I know of online.

** Farmington Canal Heritage Trail (http://www.ct.gov/dmv...)
- Farmington to Avon, 1.3 mi. (http://www.ct.gov/dot...)
- Avon to Simsbury, 4.5 mi. (http://www.ct.gov/dot...)
- Simsbury to East Grandby, 7.25 mi. (http://www.ct.gov/dot...)
- East Grandby to Suffield, 5 mi. (http://www.ct.gov/dot...)
- Suffield to Massachusetts, 1.3 mi. (http://www.ct.gov/dot...)

For more information, see http://www.ct.gov/dot...
